benchmark_details.name: GeoGramBench
benchmark_details.overview: GeoGramBench is a benchmark of 500 carefully refined problems organized by a tailored three-level taxonomy that assesses models' ability to translate programmatic drawing code into accurate and abstract geometric reasoning.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To evaluate the capability of large language models in geometric program reasoning.

data.source: Curated from open-source mathematics datasets, including NuminaMath-1.5, HARP, and Omni-MATH.
data.annotation: Human verified for correctness and standardized formatting.

methodology.calculation: Mean accuracy calculated over multiple model outputs.
methodology.interpretation: An accuracy percentage indicates the model's effectiveness on different complexity levels of geometric reasoning.
